intro: Pabstiella pleurothalloides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, closely packed leaves that form a dense, cushion-like structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sorocarps, are borne on short stalks and contain the spores. Pabstiella pleurothalloides plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
